replies.bodyText:
This is slightly embarrassing, but when I change it to FilePosition it refuses to compile:
> Task :junit-platform-engine:compileJava FAILED
/junit5/junit-platform-engine/src/main/java/org/junit/platform/engine/support/descriptor/FilePosition.java:85: error: fromQuery(String) in org.junit.platform.engine.support.descriptor.FilePosition cannot hide fromQuery(String) in org.junit.platform.engine.discovery.FilePosition
        public static Optional<FilePosition> fromQuery(String query) {
                                             ^
  return type Optional<org.junit.platform.engine.support.descriptor.FilePosition> is not compatible with Optional<org.junit.platform.engine.discovery.FilePosition>
1 error

I fail to understand why this is only an issue for this static method and not the other two static from methods that take one or more int arguments. Any suggestions on what to do here?
replies.author: timtebeek

replies.bodyText: I've briefly explored using Optional<? extends FilePosition> in the superclass FilePosition, but that leaks out into usage of that method regrettably. :\
replies.author: timtebeek
mpkorstanje

replies.bodyText:
I've briefly explored using Optional<? extends FilePosition> in the superclass FilePosition, but that leaks out into usage of that method regrettably. :\

It isn't pretty but I think that is okay.
It is possible to assign List<Number> to List<? extends Number> so once the old FilePosition and the extends Number are removed it shouldn't break anything.
